Package magPie

Class Magpie4

  • java.lang.Object
    • magPie.Magpie4

  • public class Magpie4
extends java.lang.Object
    Version:
    12/05/2017 A program to carry on conversations with a human user. This version:
    • Uses advanced search for keywords
    • Will transform statements as well as react to keywords
    , April 2012
    Author:
    Joshua Ciffer, Laurie White

      • transformIWantToStatement

        private java.lang.String transformIWantToStatement​(java.lang.String statement)
        Take a statement with "I want to ." and transform it into "What would it mean to ?"
        Parameters:
        statement - the user statement, assumed to contain "I want to"
        Returns:
        the transformed statement

      • transformIWantStatement

        private java.lang.String transformIWantStatement​(java.lang.String statement)
        Takes a statement where the user states "I want" something, and the computer responds with "Would you really be happy if you had" something?
        Parameters:
        statement - The statement the user enters.
        Returns:
        Returns the computer's response to the user statement.

      • transformILikeStatement

        private java.lang.String transformILikeStatement​(java.lang.String statement)
        Takes a statement where the user enters "I like" something, and the computer responds with "Why do you like" something? Adds what the user likes to the ArrayList likes, and removes it from dislikes if it was there.
        Parameters:
        statement - The statement the user enters.
        Returns:
        Returns the computer's response to the statement.

      • transformILoveStatement

        private java.lang.String transformILoveStatement​(java.lang.String statement)
        Takes a statement where the user enters "I love" something, and the computer responds with "Why do you love" something? Adds what the user likes to the ArrayList likes, and removes it from dislikes if it was there.
        Parameters:
        statement - The statement the user enters.
        Returns:
        Returns the computer's response to the statement.

      • transformIDislikeStatement

        private java.lang.String transformIDislikeStatement​(java.lang.String statement)
        Takes a statement where the user enters "I dislike" something, and the computer responds with "Why do you dislike" something? Adds what the user dislikes to the ArrayList dislikes, and removes it from likes if it was there.
        Parameters:
        statement - The statement the user enters.
        Returns:
        Returns the computer's response to the statement.

        Returns:

        Parameters:
        statement - The statement the user enters.
        Returns:
        The computer's response to the user's statement.

      • findKeyword

        private int findKeyword​(java.lang.String statement,
                        java.lang.String goal,
                        int startPos)
        Search for one word in phrase. The search is not case sensitive. This method will check that the given goal is not a substring of a longer string (so, for example, "I know" does not contain "no").
        Parameters:
        statement - the string to search
        goal - the string to search for
        startPos - the character of the string to begin the search at
        Returns:
        the index of the first occurrence of goal in statement or -1 if it's not found

      • findKeyword

        private int findKeyword​(java.lang.String statement,
                        java.lang.String goal)
        Search for one word in phrase. The search is not case sensitive. This method will check that the given goal is not a substring of a longer string (so, for example, "I know" does not contain "no"). The search begins at the beginning of the string.
        Parameters:
        statement - the string to search
        goal - the string to search for
        Returns:
        the index of the first occurrence of goal in statement or -1 if it's not found

      • getRandomResponse

        private java.lang.String getRandomResponse​()
        Pick a default response to use if nothing else fits.
        Returns:
        a non-commital string
